I have been playing around with heritrix for a few weeks now and I am 
in the process of turning it loose on a controlled environment for 
one of my research strands. I am currently using version 0.9.0. My 
objective is to limit the amount of data scooped from a site onto the 
ARC file. I tried using the HTTP Processor max-length-bytes and the 
Archiver max-size-bytes.

The Processor max-length-bytes seems to work at some level as the 
requests are reported as length-truncated in the logs, but the actual 
HTML files still make it into the archive.

The Archive max-size-bytes appears to be ignored. Looking at the 
code, it does not seem to be used by the ARCWriterProcessor class or 
any other class for that matter...I just starting digging through the 
code earlier today.

I continue my experimentation and code reading, but figured, I'd 
check in to see if I am missing something very obvious or if anyone 
had experienced similar behavior.

Thanks in advance for your time,
Seb
